entry.title: Cora Agnes Benneson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cora Agnes Benneson (pictured), one of the first female lawyers in New England, was rejected by Harvard Law School because "the equipments were too limited to make suitable provision for receiving women"?

entry.title: To Zion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lauryn Hill's song "To Zion" is about her decision not to terminate her pregnancy despite facing pressure to do so?

entry.title: Philipp Tanzer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Philipp Tanzer has been an army medic, artist, firefighter, hairdresser, massage therapist, festival organiser, political candidate and gay porn star?

entry.title: Supie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that food was left to rot outside after the supermarket Supie went out of business?

entry.title: Bosellia mimetica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the sea slug Bosellia mimetica benefits from photosynthesis?

entry.title: Panos Katseris (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in December 2022 Panos Katseris scored his first goal for the Italian club Catanzaro less than a minute after kick-off?

entry.title: maternity care deserts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 35.6 percent of counties in the United States are classified as maternity care deserts?

entry.title: first settler of Asotin County (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the "first settler of Asotin County" was the second?
